title: Age, Politics and Conditional Distributions
question_text:
Researchers wanted to investigate how an individual's age relates to his or her political leanings. A random sample of $100$ individuals in each of three age categories was asked to classify themselves as being "Liberal" or "Conservative". The results are displayed in the side-by-side bar graph below.
Based on this display, what is the conditional distribution of Liberals by age category?
